meanings.definition: A loud, prolonged sound resembling a cry.
meanings.sent1: The waws of the siren pierced the quiet night.
meanings.sent2: I heard the waws of a baby crying in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The waws of the cat outside made me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The waws of the wind echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The waws of the thunderstorm were deafening.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, prolonged sound resembling a cry.
meanings.sent1: The injured animal waws in pain.
meanings.sent2: She waws loudly for help when she got lost.
meanings.sent3: The old car waws as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house waws with ghostly voices.
meanings.sent5: The child waws with joy upon seeing the surprise.

meanings.sent1: The waws of the ocean crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent2: He surfed on the waws of the sea with skill.
meanings.sent3: The waws of the crowd carried the singer's voice.
meanings.sent4: The waws of the flag fluttered in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The waws of emotion overwhelmed her during the speech.
